newsitem.title: ESTONIA: Estonian Hansapank record profit in Nov.
newsitem.headline: Estonian Hansapank record profit in Nov.

text.p: The net profit for leading Estonian bank Hansapank came to 181.4 million kroons for the 11 months of the year, the bank said on Wednesday.
It said it made a profit of 30.1 million kroons in the month of November, its highest monthly profit, following 23.1 million in October.
"Extraordinary income had a noteworthy effect on the influence of the profit this month," the bank said in a statement.
It said that a re-evaluation of the value of its Baltic Growth Fund after it started trading on the stock exchange led to extraordinary income of 10.1 million kroons.
It said it also sold the shares in owned in Savings Bank and got back 5.3 million kroons of loans it had already posted as losses.
The bank also said that its assets came to 5.275 billion kroons at the end of November, a rise of 293.8 million kroons last month.
"From the beginning of the year, total assets have grown by 56.3 percent," Hansapank said.
It said its loan portfolio had risen by 270 million kroons in November and reached just under three billion kroons at the end of last month.
